Sentencas: In this paper, a conventional solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is modeled, and its performance is assessed to investigate the main challenges that limit low temperature operation.
Titulo: A performance assessment study on solid oxide fuel cells for reduced operating temperatures

Sentencas: SOFCs have numerous advantages over other fuel cell technologies; however, a major drawback of SOFCs is the high operating temperature (over 600 degrees C) which significantly reduces SOFCs lifetime and constrains manufacturing materials to costly produced composites.
Titulo: A performance assessment study on solid oxide fuel cells for reduced operating temperatures

Sentencas: Therefore, the development of a low temperature solid oxide fuel cell (LT-SOFC) will improve the cost effectiveness of this technology and thereby enhance efficient energy utilization and contribute to CO2 emission reduction.
Titulo: A performance assessment study on solid oxide fuel cells for reduced operating temperatures

Sentencas: In this regard, a model is employed to predict the conventional SOFC performance under different operating and design conditions, in general, and at low operating temperatures, in particular.
Titulo: A performance assessment study on solid oxide fuel cells for reduced operating temperatures

Sentencas: Furthermore, the contribution of each of the polarizations is evaluated.
Titulo: A performance assessment study on solid oxide fuel cells for reduced operating temperatures

Sentencas: The model results are validated through a comparison with published experimental data and found to be in a good agreement with a maximum possible error value of 10.3% in cell potential and power density output.
Titulo: A performance assessment study on solid oxide fuel cells for reduced operating temperatures

Sentencas: The results show that conventional SOFCs are vulnerable to a significant performance reduction when operating at low temperatures (below 600 degrees C).
Titulo: A performance assessment study on solid oxide fuel cells for reduced operating temperatures

Sentencas: In addition, the polarization that SOFCs experience at low operating temperatures is mainly attributed to electrolyte ohmic loss.
Titulo: A performance assessment study on solid oxide fuel cells for reduced operating temperatures
